articles.description: Swastik Pipe will raise Rs 62.52 crore through its public issue, which will be utilised for working capital, general corporate purposes, and issue expenses.
articles.content:
Swastik Pipe on September 26 fixed the price brand of its initial public offering (IPO) opening for subscription on September 29 and closing on October 3 at Rs 97-100 per share.

articles.title: Tata Sons to halve the number of listed companies from 29 to 15: Reports - Business Standard
articles.description: Under the current chairman N Chandrasekaran Tata Sons has been taking steps to consolidate its business to improve its efficiency
articles.content: Tata Sons has decided to halve the number of listed companies from 29 to 15 in the coming months. This is being done to focus on investing in bigger entities that can compete ably in the marketplace,… [+1748 chars]

articles.author: Udit Misra
articles.title: ExplainSpeaking: Why RBI is likely to cut GDP growth forecast and raise interest rates - The Indian Express
articles.description: Six percent is emerging as the key macro number to watch out for in the lead up to the next general elections in 2024. The RBI cannot allow inflation to soar above it and the government cannot allow the GDP growth rate to fall below it.
articles.content:

articles.author: Reuters
articles.title: Apple says it will manufacture iPhone 14 in India - DAWN.com
articles.description: Apple could make one out of four iPhones in India by 2025, say analysts at J.P. Morgan.
articles.content:
Apple Inc said on Monday it will manufacture its latest iPhone 14 in India, as the tech giant moves some of its production away from China.
